full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 463 Filed 11/15/21 Page 2 of 2
also have their temperature taken when they arrive at the courthouse. Only persons who meet the entry requirements established by the questionnaire and whose temperatures are below 100.4 degrees will be allowed to enter the courthouse. All visitors must wear a mask that covers the person's nose and mouth. Bandannas, gaiters, and masks with valves are not permitted. If a person does not have an approved mask, a screener will provide one. Anyone who fails to comply with the COVID-19 protocols that have been adopted by the Court will be required to leave the courthouse. There are no exceptions. For more information, please see https://www.nysd.uscourts.gov/covid-19-coronavirus.
SO ORDERED.
Dated: November 15, 2021
New York, New York

ALISON J. NATHAN
United States District Judge

2

additional_notes: The document is a court order regarding COVID-19 protocols in a courthouse. It is signed by Judge Alison J. Nathan and dated November 15, 2021. The document is clear and legible, with no visible redactions or damage.
